channel.title: Outreach on measured.
channel.description: Recent content in Outreach on measured.

item.title: if we're really committed to diversity, crying should be okay
item.description: I believe that all people struggle with adulting, and that no one is perfect. Although my lifetime has shaped me as noticably different to many people, for the first time in a long while I feel I’ve been able to make use of my strengths. never been so proud #choosemaths https://t.co/8gptuDY4Dy — Charles T. Gray (@cantabile) July 16, 2018 I may seem different1 but, to employ statistical parlance, conditioning on a lifetime of being socially demeaned, my bias from the point estimate of the expected value approximates zero.

item.title: ikigai
item.description: Today, I talk at the AMSI Choose Maths Day at La Trobe. I’ve been giving a bunch of career-oriented outreach talks about the concept of ikigai, a purpose for being, a reason to get out of bed. I like to replace do what you’re good at with do what you enjoy getting good at. Seemed like time to put some slides together. I’m cutting down on the number of bullet points, but I’m not sure I’m ready to go with just visuals, like I saw Kara rock at Seattle RLadies.
